keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after a struggle with police officers while being detained for a suspected break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and played six seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and one with the Oakland Raiders.
He had a distinguished career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during arrest; no further details were released.
Martin was transported to a hospital and died at age 36; autopsy has not yet been released.
The incident sparked public mourning from the community, including Mayor Barbara Lee and the Buccaneers, highlighting concerns about police interactions and use of force.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers during a break-in investigation at a home in Oakland. The incident, which occurred early Saturday, led to his hospitalization and death; the cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending. Martin, a first-round draft pick in 2012, had a successful career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors. The event has sparked public mourning from the Buccaneers, Oakland mayor Barbara Lee, and the community, raising concerns about police conduct and accountability in high-profile encounters involving athletes.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention in Oakland
